definition[0]: to change position so that there is more space for someone else
example[0]: Move over a little, so I can get in.
definition[1]: to start using a different system, doing a different type of work etc
example[1]: Most companies have moved over to computer-aided design systems.
definition[2]: to change jobs, especially within the same organization or industry
example[2]: The company’s new publisher just moved over from Villard Books.
definition[3]: used when saying that something new is becoming more popular than something older – used humorously
example[3]: Move over, Armani, there’s a new designer taking the fashion scene by storm.
